Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: Subsequent to my letter of 19 December 2005, 32 reinstatements of letters of credit were processed, 84 letters of credit were extended from 2004 (32) and 2005 (48) to 2006 (see table 4), 4 letters of credit were extended from 2006 to 2007 (see table 5), 5 letters of credit were fully paid, 1 letter of credit (communication number 1000446) amendment was rejected by the beneficiary, 1 letter of credit was cancelled and 3 letters of credit were partially paid and the residual balance of the letters of credit were cancelled. Consequently, there are 237 letters of credit expiring in 2006 with a total value of United States dollars 838 million (see table 4). In addition, subsequent to 31 December 2005, the relevant authorities of the Government of Iraq and suppliers have indicated to the United Nations the need for amendments for 63 letters of credit associated with communication numbers 601799, 631025, 631026, 631028, 631031, 631157, 701387, 702153, 702787, 730367, 730770, 730897, 800329, 800975, 801181, 801344, 801547, 802719, 802954, 802974, 830306, 830875, 900034, 900045, 900209, 930181, 930599, 1000299, 1000426, 1000445, 1000446, 1000454, 1000752, 1001243, 1001314, 1001374, 1001466, 1001474, 1001516, 1001517, 1001519, 1002233, 1002236, 1030349, 1100100, 1100335, 1100581, 1100926, 1101152, 1200057, 1200447, 1200555, 1200564, 1200933, 1201414, 1201514, 1230025, 1230127, 1230271, 1230497, 1230577, 1230582 and 1300010.
